  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39164].
  {panel}

There needs to be an option to disable per project (admin driven) or per issue (user driven). 

Multiple threads, issues, and discussions exist on this topic. Previous issues have been closed as wontfix but not detailed why. 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18566
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23620

Disabling the wiki-style editor or requiring a noformat/code macro is insufficient for software development teams that will often need to use brackets and parenthesis.

fields.description:
Hi,

We did a jira upgrade this morning all data are well displayed configuration ...

but some filters are no more working when we are filtering on some customfield.
'when we display the information regarding our change resquest all is well included" custom field is ok.
- if I made an update like modifying the value the filter is working again.

the issue is a trigger to put our version in operationnal use.

Thanks for your support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39161].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian Support,

Currently, we are working to upgrade our Jira platform to the latest version. We also would like to make it support external CAS for authentication that requires us to change all existing login usernames to another format.

The current usernames are in short names and we look to find a way to do bulk right-padding with a common string '@something.com' for all usernames.

I hope I have expressed well our requirement. Looking forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Sam
fields.summary: To bulk change usernames by right-padding with a common string on Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39160].
  {panel}

Hi, 

We do spend hours on projects, some are billable and some non-billable. Basically I would like to have custom filed in worklog screen where I can get two worklog filed, 1) billable and 2) non-billable. 

Moreover when I extract the report I should be able to get report considering billable and non billable hours. This should be visible on issue screen too along with Estimated time, Logged time, Remaining time, Non-billable time. 

Thanks
Jaydip
fields.summary: How do I differentiate Billable and Non-billable hours in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39156].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

If you integrate JIRA with Perforce, you will only have the option to map custom fields, not the system fields. There are only a few system fields mapped by default with Perforce, like "Issue Type" and "Priority", but not all the fields (like "Components", "Labels", etc.)

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the user to map system fields to Perforce just as the custom fields.
fields.summary: Perforce doesn't allow JIRA to map system fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39148].
  {panel}

As an analyst, 
I want to be able to change ownership or share ownership of a filter I created with/to another user 
So that they are able to manage the filter contents. 

I often create filters for users, especially those that are more complex or, because of my BA role, I create the initial filters and board setup for the product owners; however, the product owners (or those that are requesting my help), actually should own or manage the filters. 

Today, I create a filter, share it. Then that user is required to create their own and then change the filter for a board or gadget that the filter is often associated with. I have to remember to go back and delete these filters as I have no need to have them in my list. 

I want the ability to change the ownership of my own filters to someone else, or even better, actually share the ownership or management of a filter. 

As an administrator, we have hundreds if not thousands of filters that no one uses, but I have no way of knowing which ones they are to get them cleaned up. 

As an administrator, I often get requests to go change ownership. 

And, as an administrator and analyst, I often have to go in and change ownership to me, change their filter, and then change ownership back.
fields.summary: Change owner and share ownership of filters
The Create Issue box does not resize with the window
Make the advanced JQL search box collapsible for longer JQL queries
As a user I would like to be able to see another user's email address given that I have the correct permissions to do so

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39133].
  {panel}

Hi JIRA team,

With the Bulk change fonctionnality, I would like to be able to add a label on a group of issues and not only to overwrite with a new label.
Instead of getting the flag : "This change will overwrite any previous labels", I would rather have a checkbox "adding" or "overwrite".

Is it possible ? Is it on your roadmap ?
What do you think about this improvement ?
It is very important to get this because of one of my uses cases on requirements processes.

If you need more information, please do contact me.
Karine MARTINS
fields.summary: Bulk change to "add a label" and not only "overwrite"
Shortcut for edit workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39129].
  {panel}

Migrating from JIRA 6.1.6 to current JIRA 6.2.7, we detect a bug in the translation in 6.2.7. In the Issue screen, the status action button Reopen and start review located in the header is not translated into Spanish (es_ES). In JIRA 6.1.6 this action button label was translated and displayed Ok, but in 6.2.7 is not translated, showing the default english translation. Also the tooltip of the action button doesn't appears at all, as opposed of rest of action buttons that display tooltips translated.

!Screenshot1.png!

The translation is already available in JIRA 6.2.7

!Screenshot2.png!
fields.summary: Issue status action Reopen and start review not translated
jira-core 6.3 com.atlassian.jira.project.ProjectHistoryLinkFactory breaks API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39127].
  {panel}

'Email From' (the pretty display name, not the actual address which is referred to as just 'From' in the global mailservers ui or 'Email' in the project ui) supports:
${fullname}, ${email} and ${email.hostname}

Sometimes it would be great to just have first_name (pull from database or use fullname till first space...) aka givenName

Additionally you even might want to use user_name (database) as it may be different than email / email_address (database).

fullname auto maps out: first_name, lower_first_name,last_name,lower_last_name,display_name,lower_display_name

and there's other key/values you can set on the user that would be great to expose, or in the future JRA-6354

such that you wouldn't have to put (blah/department) as part of the fullname to expose some info

"fullname (jira)" <jira@domain.com>
fields.summary: Support more variables in 'Email From' display such as first_name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39123].
  {panel}

Hi,

In your markup documentation:

https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all

It is difficult for a new user to find the markup for "strikethrough", because it is erroneously called "deleted" in the documentation.

The correct term for this is "strikethrough", not "deleted".  See the wikipedia page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strikethrough

If the documentation is updated accordingly, the result will be a better user experience.
fields.summary: Incorrect name used for strikethrough markup in documentation

We have lot of projects with lot of versions and administrering is tedious - I must click the "cog" icon in the versions's line, then select the "Release" link in dropdown menu.

It was simplifier (and easier to use) in old versions of Jira - there were direct links "Release, Archive, Delete" in each version line.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39112].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

On moving Issue to another project, JIRA doesn't check the permission for Assignable User. JIRA should not fill that Assignee field during moving an issue, if the former assignee doesn't have *Assignable User* in project B.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in projectA
 # Give UserA *Assignable User* permission for projectA
 # Assign the created issue in projectA to UserA
 # Create projectB
 # Move Issue from projectA to projectB

h3. Expected Results


Assignee field should be left blank as they original assignee doesn't have permission in projectB.
h3. Actual Results

The original assignee is still assigned the issue in projectB although he doesn't have *Assignable User* permission in projectB
h3. Notes

The Reporter field is also affected by this bug in the same way as described for the assignee field.

Issues can be also moved to another project  through "bulk change".
fields.summary: JIRA is not checking the Assignable User permission when moving an issue between projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39111].
  {panel}

In [JIRA 6.2 Release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.2+Release+Notes], in the "Simple issue type configuration" session, the screenshot and text are not very clear for the customers. By looking the screenshot, seems that any Project Administrator will see the option to configure the Issue Type workflow, by simply clicking on it. However, when you go to that screen, only if you are a Administrator you will see an "Edit Workflow" button on the top of that screen and then will be able to configure the Workflow:

!systemadmin.png|thumbnail!

In the actual screenshot, this button is not present however the user is able to edit the workflow. Here is what I see when I am a Project Administrator but not a Administrator:

!projectadmin.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if we can change that information to avoid any misunderstanding.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.2 release notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39108].
  {panel}

Scenario:
# On my Jira Cloud instance, I create a user.
# In Chrome, I log into the instance with these credentials
# I issue the following REST API call in Chrome:
{code}
https://(instance)/rest/api/2/user/assignable/search?project=(project)
{code}

Expected:
* A list of users

Actual:
* Error 401 Unauthorized

*Remark1:*
If I issue the same query after logging in as the site administrator, I get the list of users

*Remark2:*
If I pump up the rights of the user above, up to be part of all groups, the REST API still doesn't go through, although the permission helper says this user is administrator of the project.
fields.summary: REST API authentication error when asking for list of users for a project

Create a custom tab in JIRA issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39104].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm part of a software company.  JIRA is our lifeblood for support issues for our customers.  We actually have built a lot of internal applications fed data from/to JIRA so that people within our company can get information about our customers.

In many cases, we have folks who need to perform actions on customer information (look at their groups, change their groups, add them to groups).    This is something only allowable by jira-administrators.  These employees do not need to have access to everything else a jira-administrator has.

Has there been any consideration for making global permissions more granular than just "system-administrator" and "administrator?"
fields.summary: Additional Permissions/Roles in JIRA
Ability to Disable Add Field via View Issue page by Administrator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39101].
  {panel}

Environment: Windows 7 Professional, SP1

Browser: Firefox ESR 24.6.0 ESR (corporate approved version) or Chrome Version 35.0.1916.153 m

Java 7 V60 (also automagically installed by corporate)

We used to be able to click the three grey dots in the Agile board view and select Atttach Screenshot and there would be a box where we could paste a clipped image. Now the container doesn't appear and clicking either the PrtScn button or Ctrl + V buttons does nothing. (see attachment:  attachattempt.jpg).  Entering a filename and clicking Upload generates a 500 error. (see attacherror.jpg, below)

I didn't change the system permissions. Adding attachments is still enabled. What happened and how do I get the ability to attach screenshots back? (Yes, I know I can save them and attach the file, but that's not quite as convenient).

I tried opening an issue and using More-->Attach Screenshot and it appears to be working properly.

We first noticed this problem around mid-June, 2014
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot not working in JIRA OnDemand (but it did before!) from Agile board (but works from open ticket)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39099].
  {panel}

Based on this documentation:
- [Changing the Project Key Format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format]

There is a list of supported project key pattern in which I believe to make sure that there is no confusion between Project Key and Issue Key.

But, with the Project Key Pattern is possible to be customized there is still a possibility that the user still input an unsupported project key pattern. Therefore, it would be useful if there is a validator or warning when the user tries to set an unsupported project key pattern.
fields.summary: Validation or Warning when Trying to Use Unsupported Project Key Pattern.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39098].
  {panel}

Documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS
bq. You can also redirect users from HTTP URLs to HTTPS URLs by choosing the 'HTTP & HTTPS' profile in the JIRA configuration tool. However, if you want to only redirect certain pages to HTTPS, you can do this manually. *To do this*, select the 'HTTPS only' profile in the JIRA configuration tool and save the configuration.

The context of *To do this* above is not so clear.

It seems that the last statement in this paragraph is incomplete. It is currently easy to read the last to sentences together and come up with the idea: "... if you want to only redirect certain pages to HTTPS, you can do this manually. To do this, select the 'HTTPS only' profile in the JIRA configuration tool and save the configuration."

However, that doesn't make much sense and will be incorrect because:
# simply selecting the 'HTTPS only' profile in the JIRA configuration tool isn't sufficient to achieve http to https redirection
# Also,  "selecting the 'HTTPS only' profile in the JIRA configuration tool" in the later statement, doesn't match the context of "you can do this manually" in the previous statement.

I'm not sure if I explained the problem with the paragraph clearly.
fields.summary: Confusing/incomplete paragraph in Running JIRA over SSL documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39091].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator or user, I wish that JIRA introduces a system of error codes so that finding help on error situations is straightforward and requires less guess work and search engine gimmicks.

h2.Advantages
# A JIRA Project or Confluence space could be setup with the error codes for public documentation
# Errors in the JIRA UI could be linked to these error code pages so that administrators and users find it easy to solve problems
# When the error codes are printed in logs, troubleshooting or supporting will also be much easier.
fields.summary: Introduce error codes for supportability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39087].
  {panel}

This issue is mentioned in the comments by @Halley on JRA-1898, a rather old feature request. But I believe it's somewhat different than that issue and really should be filed by itself as a Bug.

Jira’s comment notification system isn’t really reliable because we can’t depend on users getting comment notifications all of the time.

We have set up a notification scheme that sends an email notification to all issue watchers and the issue assignee whenever anyone makes or edits a comment on the issue. This works fine when someone adds the comment from within Jira itself.

We also allow users to email back a reply to these notification emails, and we're set up so their email replies are added to the issue as and additional comment. This too works.

What doesn't work is, if a user includes any kind of attachment, regular or inline, in the reply email, Jira will not send a notification email that there is a new comment. If the user deletes all attachments, images, etc. before sending it, however, and just sends text in the reply, Jira will send out a notification. Either way the comment is still being added to the issue. It's just a problem with the notifications not being sent out unless the comment contains only text.

The problem is Jira assumes that anything that isn’t text in the email is an attachment. That includes things that aren’t really attachments, like inline images and logos that appear in the message or in a sig. Also, since every notification that Jira sends out has icons and logos in it, simply replying to these sends back a message full of “attachments,” thus defeating the comment feature and filling up the issue with garbage “attachments” that really should not be part of the issue record.

I can ask users to delete everything except their text reply when replying to a comment via email, but this isn’t really practical since, of course, your average user won’t remember to do that. Also, sending out a notification every time an issue is updated doesn’t work for us. Users will get way to many notifications over the course of the issues’ life, most of which they will not understand. We really just want to notify them of all new comments.

I see two possible solutions (this is in order of my preference)

1. If Jira had a setting to block attachments via email that would solve this problem (I know JEMH can do something like this, but its price is very high to use for only this purpose).

2. If Jira could be set to ignore any email attachment with “Content-Disposition: inline”, I think this also would fix this problem. If its “Content-Disposition: attachment” it should add it to the issue, but ignore otherwise.

BTW all users here have a Jira account, and this does not seem to be related to their "my changes" selection under their profile settings. Notifications aren't going out to anyone in these cases, regardless if they sent the reply or not.
fields.summary: Notifications of new comments not being sent out if comment comes from a reply to an email notification

HI,
I've noticed a wrong link (and a spelling error at the same time) when using the notification helper. (See screenshot)

Steps to reproduce:
# Log into JIRA
# Go to the a project administration and select Notifications
# Click the notification helper
# in the user field you can select any user ; in the issue field select an issue from a project where this user is not the project lead.
# press Submit -> The notification helper show several 'errors' and possible solutions.
# In the solution for the Project Lead you'll have a link called '<Project Name> project people confiugration' (notice the spelling error?)
#click this link, it will give an error because it's redirecting you to the following url : http://<jira-instance>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<ProjectKey>/people which does not exist.

screenshot : !error-screenshot.jpg!
fields.summary: Wrong link and spelling error in notification helper

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39055].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for following this ticketing and keeping in the loop of our support of MS SQL Server 2014. We fully intend to support MS SQL Server 2014 in the near future and will inform everyone on this ticket once support has commenced. 

h5. When can I expect it?
Support for MS SQL Server 2014 will occur in the next *_minor release_* of JIRA, granted there are no unforeseen events that prevent this support. If this does occur, I will relay any information back to this ticket to keep you all informed as best I can. The next minor release for JIRA is set for *Q1 2016*. 

h5. I can't wait that long, what should I do?
If you or your organisation cannot wait until Q1 2016 for MS SQL Server 2014, I recommend updating to MS SQL Server 2012 in the interim. We will be ending support for MS SQL Server 2005 in the next major release, JIRA 7.0, and it is recommended you do not stay on this version of MS SQL Server when it comes time to upgrade. 

h5. I have more questions
Please feel free to email me or comment on this issue and I'll do my best to get back to you as soon as I can.

Thank you for your understanding and patience. :) 

Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
kewilliams at atlassian dot com  
{panel}

///

h3. Summary
Microsoft SQL Server 2014 is not certified/supported for use with recent versions of JIRA. JIRA Administrators should able to migrate onto recent versions of Microsoft SQL Server in order to maintain compliance with internal policies within SOE's. 

h3. Environment
SQL Server, 2014, with recent versions of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Should Support Microsoft SQL Server 2014.

h3. Actual Results
[Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] does not list SQL Server 2014 as a supported Database.
fields.summary: Official Support for MS SQL Server 2014
How to export the Comment field to Excel
Download Source option not available on Development Panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39045].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Start an import process from a Redmine instance
# In the issue type mapping step, map one issue type as a "Subtask" for JIRA
# Finish the import

h3. Current behaviour

The issues will be imported and subtasks will be created without mapping the parent issues. So orphaned subtasks will be created in JIRA.

h3. Expected behaviour

Map the parent-subtask hierarchy from Redmine and automatically create the relationship.
fields.summary: Redmine Import allow creation of subtasks without specifying parent issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39014].
  {panel}

I will often:
# See something wrong in the UI for a product.
# Take a screenshot of the problem.
# Create a JIRA issue for the problem.

However, in step 3., I get tripped up because the screenshot of the problem is on the clipboard and I either have to:
# Save the screenshot to disk and then add it to the issue.
# Save the issue and then return to it and use "Attach Screenshot"

It would be *much* nicer if I could simply attach the screenshot in the initial Create dialog.
fields.summary: Add "Attach Screenshot" to Create

fields.description:
I'm trying to pass report parameter from gadget, and then would like to keep it after going through configuration page, but it's lost.

I expected that hidden report parameter will make it work, but it does not. Is there other way to pass parameter, similarly to selectedProjectId parameter?

Scenario:

{code}
    <report ...>
            ...
            <property>
                <key>reportingDay</key>
                <name>reportingDay</name>
                <description>reportingDay</description>
                <type>hidden</type>
            </property>
        </properties>
    </report>
{code}

See also [Configuring Plugins with Object Configurable Parameters|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Configuring+Plugins+with+Object+Configurable+Parameters]

Url: {{http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin:projectpivot&reportingDay=2}}

But after clicking Next on report configuration page value is lost, e.g. {{http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?reportingDay=&reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin%3Aprojectpivot&Next=Next}}
fields.summary: Report module plugin development: hidden report parameter is lost on report configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38995].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Basic search is unavailable when performing simple JQL searches involving users who have been renamed in the past.  This effects both searching from a saved filter or from a gadget on a dashboard which may have previously worked. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with any username
# Browse to the issue navigator and search for this user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# You will be able to search either in Basic or Advanced mode
# Now rename this user with any value (adding an extra letter will work)
# Browse back to the issue navigator and, in Advanced mode, search for the user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# The "Basic" search will be disabled
# If you hover over the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to switch between Basic and Advanced mode

h3. Actual Results
The Basic search is disabled and if you hover over the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown
 
h3. Notes
If you are unsure whether a username has changed run the following SQL:
{code}select * from app_user where lower_user_name='<username>'{code}
and it will return the current and previous username

h3.Workaround
Rename the user back to the original username, or use advanced search instead
fields.summary: After renaming an user, if you search for reporter or assignee the "Basic" search is disabled

fields.description:
Jira hangs when moving an issue to the resolved state. It happened in several projects in one instance of Jira but not all projects using this workflow but it only happens after an upgrade to 6.0.8 from 4.4.4.

STEPS TO RECREATE
- Create a new instance of Jira with an empty MySQL database
- Import the XML database (it's too big to attach, how can I get it to you?)
- Display issue JIRA-44893
- Click Resolve
- Watch it hang
fields.summary: Jira hangs when moving an issue to the resolved state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38979].
  {panel}

Allow project admins to choose notification and permission scheme from fixed list.

Rather than always bugging a jira-administrator to adjust notifications/permissions, the jira-administrator could create a few sanctioned/official schemes that the Administer Projects (Project Role Administrators by default) could select from.

notificationscheme and permissionscheme need a new DB column to the effect of 'ALLOWPROJECTADJUST' or 'SANCTIONEDLIST' default NULL = 0/FALSE/NO

Thus any with NULL are not presented in a drop down list. 

(Will have to expose the button for actions > 'use a different scheme' to the Administer Projects permission).

JRA-28184 is marked as a bug in documentation, so hence this new feature request.
fields.summary: Allow project admins to choose notification and permission schemes from fixed list.
